TextView.android:text: These settings control the tone used for Morse code letter playback. Adjust tone frequency, volume, envelope shape, and keying style to customize the signal characteristics.

These settings create realistic CW background noise using Brownian noise with LFO-modulated bandpass filtering. Enable 'Background Noise' checkbox first, then adjust parameters. Use 'Test Continuously' for real-time experimentation. LFO frequencies control atmospheric modulation speed - lower values (0.05-0.15Hz) create slow, realistic variations.
